conclusion: Analyze the motion of objects A and B using physics principles to calculate the time for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane.

Two objects, A and B, each with a mass of 1 kg, attached to a massless string passing over a pulley at the top of an inclined plane with an angle of 37Â°. Object A is initially at a height of 1 m above the ground, while object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane.
Initially, both objects are at rest and accelerate downward due to gravity when released.
The acceleration of object A is \(g \cos \theta\) and the acceleration of object B is \(g \sin \theta\). Since the masses are equal, the acceleration of object A is less than that of object B.
Calculate the time for object A to reach the ground using \( t = \sqrt{\frac{2h}{g \cos \theta}} \).
Substitute values \(h = 1 \, \text{m}\), \(g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2\), and \(\theta = 37^\circ\) to get \( t = \sqrt{\frac{2}{10 \times 0.798}} \).
After the connection breaks, object B moves solely under gravity along the inclined plane.
Calculate the time for object B to return using \( t = \sqrt{\frac{2L}{g \sin \theta}} \).
Assume the time for object B to return is twice the time it took for object A to reach the ground, resulting in \( t = 2 \times 0.5 \, \text{s} = 1 \, \text{s} \).
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is 1 second.
